content.webTitle: Chris Smalling says Manchester United’s Daley Blind is answering his critics

fields.headline: Chris Smalling says Manchester United’s Daley Blind is answering his critics
fields.bodyText: Chris Smalling believes Daley Blind has been one of the season’s outstanding centre-backs, and that the Dutchman and he are forming a formidable defensive partnership for Manchester United. When Blind signed for the club in summer 2014 he was viewed primarily as a midfielder. Yet the 26-year-old has operated at left-back and, for the majority of this campaign, at the heart of United’s rearguard. Smalling pointed to Blind’s versatility as being a major asset. “It is great knowing he is naturally a midfielder so he has that passing range and ability down to a tee and defensively he is very sound as well,” said the defender. “He brings a lot to our defensive line in being able to play the ball out and cut through teams. “He deserves more plaudits and I think he will get them if he carries on playing the way he is playing. Everyone is standing up and taking note that Daley is one of the mainstays of this team and he is keeping us ticking. “It is a good partnership. We know we can rely on each other. When there is a situation you don’t have to over cover because you don’t trust your partner. We trust each other fully and we bring out the best in each other as the games have gone on and the more games we have played together. “By each performance he is putting any critics out there to bed. He has been one of the top centre backs this year.” In Sunday’s 1-0 victory over Everton at Old Trafford Blind again impressed. “One of the main reasons the manager first put him there was he could play on the ball and he was a left footer,” Smalling said. “He has got a lot more to his game than any of us really thought. In one-on-one duels for instance, as you saw against Everton, [Romelu] Lukaku didn’t get any change from him. Daley is not the biggest or strongest but he is very clever and smart and big strikers or fast strikers don’t get any change from him. “When someone like Lukaku gets you in the position where he’s holding you off it is key to try and nick it in front of him. He can pin you in the box but he didn’t get anything out of Daley.” Blind has featured in the majority of the club’s games, making 47 appearances in all competitions. He has also played six times for Holland. Smalling said: “Ever since he joined the club he has rarely been injured. He has been able to bang out the games and have a very high consistency. He is a joy to play alongside.” Phil Jones is available again following injury and he follows Antonio Valencia’s recent return to offer Louis van Gaal a further option in defence. “It is great to have the numbers back and great to see some more senior faces on the bench. All the numbers are needed,” Smalling said. On Sunday United are at Tottenham Hotspur. The win over Everton closed Van Gaal’s team to a point behind Manchester City, who are in the final Champions League qualification berth. Smalling said: “We need to win games. Three points puts pressure on those above. It is a massive game at Spurs now. They are playing for a lot and so are we. We have found this season that we have often played better against the top teams and hopefully that continues. “There was a lot of relief [beating Everton]. It was one where we were hanging on a little bit. Against a good team one goal is never going to be enough. You want teams to slip up but if we are winning our games then we have given ourselves a chance.”
